intro: Stephania dictyoneura, commonly known as the Chinese yew or yew tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Berberidaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and red berries. The plant has a slow growth rate and can live for several centuries, making it a long-lived species. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. The leaves are thick and leathery, while the flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically appearing in spring.
